column4: "Well we’ve not given up on this, Bob, and the reason we haven’t given up on it is because it’s going to have a real impact on middle class families," McDonough told Bob Schieffer on CBS News' "Face The Nation."

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: Senate Democrats proposed a plan last week to delay the threat of the deep cuts -- which are set to kick in March 1 if lawmakers do not act -- in part by raising taxes on millionaires.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: The White House issued a statement in support of the proposal, but top Democrats acknowledged that it faces tough odds.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: Republicans have mainly opposed discussing new tax revenue, saying the matter was addressed in the deal to avert the "fiscal cliff," which included tax rate hikes on the wealthiest Americans.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: "When you look what at Senate Democratic plan and the president’s plan – both very balanced plans that get some savings in this deficit fight from spending cuts, and some savings from increased revenues," McDonough said on "Face The Nation."

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: "What our friends in the House have told us is that they will not even consider anything that includes increased revenues.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: Not even closing loopholes for corporate jets; closing loopholes for oil and gas companies."

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: Sen. John McCain (R-Ariz.), who last week expressed a possible willingness to consider supporting new tax revenue to avoid sequestration, on Sunday pressed Obama to negotiate with Republicans, and reiterated his openness to consider new tax revenues.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: "I said that I would be glad to close some loopholes about these kinds of subsidies that are outrageous and disgraceful," McCain said, as he called on Obama to step up his leadership on the matter of sequestration.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: On CBS, McDonough also underscored Obama's deficit reduction plan, saying: "Over the course of the last several months we’ve got agreement on $2.5 trillion in deficit reduction over the next 10 years.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: We’re ready to do another trillion-and-a-half to get to the $4 trillion mark that every economist in the country says we need to do to stabilize the debt problem."

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: House Budget Committee Chairman Paul Ryan (R-Wis.), who has said he thinks the sequester will happen, explained why on ABC's "This Week With George Stephanopoulos."

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: "The Senate hasn't passed a bill to replace the sequester.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: The president gave a speech showing that he'd like to replace it, but he hasn't put any details out there.

column3: McDonough: Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve not given upÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on averting sequester
column4: So that is why I conclude I believe it's going to take place," Ryan said.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: In a move making good on his promise to pressure Congress into passing immigration reform "in a timely manner," President Barack Obama's White House has leaked details of his immigration bill that reveals a plan allowing undocumented immigrants to become legal permanent residents within eight years.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: According to a report published online Saturday by USA Today, Obama's bill would create a "Lawful Prospective Immigrant" visa for the estimated 11 million immigrants living in the United States illegally.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: The bill includes more security funding and requires business owners to adopt a system for verifying the immigration status of new hires within four years, the newspaper said.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: USA Today reported that the bill would require that immigrants pass a criminal background check, submit biometric information and pay fees to qualify for the new visa.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Immigrants who served more than a year in prison for a criminal conviction or were convicted of three or more crimes and were sentenced to a total of 90 days in jail would not be eligible.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Crimes committed in other countries that would bar immigrants from legally entering the country would also be ineligible.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Those immigrants facing deportation would be eligible to apply for the visa, the newspaper reported.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Immigrants would be eligible to apply for a green card within eight years, if they learn English and U.S. history and government, and they would later be eligible to become U.S. citizens.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Last month a bipartisan group of senators announced they had agreed on the general outline of an immigration plan.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: For his part, Obama has said he would not submit his own legislation to Congress so long as law makers acted "in a timely manner."

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: If they failed, he said, "I will send up a bill based on my proposal and insist that they vote on it right away."

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Obama's chief of staff Denis McDonough says the White House hasn't proposed "anything to Capitol Hill yet" on immigration.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: McDonough said on ABC's This Week Saturday "let's make sure that it doesn't have to be proposed" because the White House and Congress are able to work out a deal.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: "What it says to me is we are doing exactly what we said we would do which is we will be prepared in the event that the bipartisan talks going on the hill, which by the way we are aggressively supporting," McDonough said on NBC's Meet the Press on Sunday.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: "If those do not work out we will have option to put out there as the President said in Las Vegas."

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Republican Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida says if such a measure was proposed however, it would be "dead on arrival" in Congress.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: “It’s a mistake for the White House to draft immigration legislation without seeking input from Republican members of Congress," Rubio said in a press release on Sunday.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: "President Obama’s leaked immigration proposal is disappointing to those of us working on a serious solution.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: The President’s bill repeats the failures of past legislation.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: It fails to follow through on previously broken promises to secure our borders, creates a special pathway that puts those who broke our immigration laws at an advantage over those who chose to do things the right way and come here legally, and does nothing to address guest workers or future flow, which serious immigration experts agree is critical to preventing future influxes of illegal immigrants.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: “Much like the President’s self-described ‘stop gap’ Deferred Action measure last year, this legislation is half-baked and seriously flawed," Rubio said.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: "It would actually make our immigration problems worse, and would further undermine the American people’s confidence in Washington’s ability to enforce our immigration laws and reform our broken immigration system."

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Others, like the California based Community Organizing group PICO, argue the president's leaked bill offers a path to citizenship that will take too long.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: “If we look to the highly successful Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) policy as a model, then the sensible thing would be for DREAMers, who’ve already submitted their paperwork and finger prints for their DACA applications, to be able to apply for green cards after the passage of immigration reform," Gordon Whitman, Policy Director for PICO National Network, said in a statement.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: "Adults should be able to apply for two-year temporary residence along the lines for DACA, followed by a green card and the ability to apply for citizenship in another five years, which is how the current law works.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: That would mean, at most, a seven-year path to citizenship."

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Clark Stevens, a White House spokesman, said Saturday that Obama still supports a bipartisan effort to craft a comprehensive immigration bill.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: "While the president has made clear he will move forward if Congress fails to act, progress continues to be made and the administration has not prepared a final bill to submit," he said in a statement.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Ali Noorani, executive director of the National Immigration Forum, described the draft bill as a "very moderate" proposal.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: While the path to citizenship was welcomed by Noorani, he said not enough attention was being paid to future immigration.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: "Commonsense immigration reform must include a functioning immigration system for the future," Noorani said in a statement.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: "Reform does not begin and end with citizenship and enforcement alone."

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency
column4: Based on reporting by the Associated Press.

column3: Report: Immigration would set an 8-year path to residency

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: WASHINGTON — The White House is working on early drafts of a comprehensive bill that would offer 11 million illegal immigrants a pathway to citizenship along the lines of the principles that the president laid out in Las Vegas several weeks ago, administration officials said.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: President Obama revealed last month that his administration had already drafted immigration legislation.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: But he said he preferred to let a bipartisan coalition of lawmakers work out their own bill that could also tighten border security and provide employers with a way to verify the citizenship status of workers.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: White House aides said that Mr. Obama remained pleased with the progress being made on Capitol Hill toward a complete overhaul of the nation’s immigration system.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: But they said he would be prepared to submit legislation if the effort among lawmakers stalls.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: “The president has made clear the principles upon which he believes any common-sense immigration reform effort should be based,” Clark Stevens, a White House spokesman, said in a statement.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: “We continue to work in support of a bipartisan effort, and while the president has made clear he will move forward if Congress fails to act, progress continues to be made and the administration has not prepared a final bill to submit.” On Saturday, USA Today reported that it had obtained portions of the president’s draft legislation.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: The newspaper said the bill would allow illegal immigrants to become permanent residents within eight years and in the meantime apply for a “Lawful Prospective Immigrant” visa.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: Mr. Stevens and other White House officials declined to comment on specific details of the report.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: Those details are similar to the statement of principles that the White House provided to reporters after Mr. Obama’s Las Vegas speech.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: A fact sheet said the president wanted to strengthen border security, provide “earned citizenship,” streamline legal immigration and crack down on employers who knowingly hire illegal immigrants.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: “Immigrants living here illegally must be held responsible for their actions by passing national security and criminal background checks, paying taxes and a penalty, going to the back of the line, and learning English before they can earn their citizenship,” the fact sheet said.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: “There will be no uncertainty about their ability to become U.S. citizens if they meet these eligibility criteria.” In a statement late Saturday night, Senator Marco Rubio, Republican of Florida, criticized Mr. Obama, saying that the details reported in the USA Today article represented legislation that “is half-baked and seriously flawed.” “It would actually make our immigration problems worse,” he said.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: Mr. Rubio, who has been among the leading Republicans pushing for a comprehensive overhaul of immigration, predicted that a bill like the one reported would be “dead on arrival in Congress.” But Demetrios G. Papademetriou, president of the Migration Policy Institute, an independent nonpartisan research center in Washington, said the eight-year temporary status for illegal immigrants in the document obtained by USA Today was “essentially the same as the probationary status” envisioned in a proposal developed by a bipartisan group of eight senators.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: During that probationary period, Mr. Papademetriou said, immigrants would have temporary visas with full work authorization.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: The bipartisan Senate proposal calls for additional border security and more effective enforcement to curb illegal immigration.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: And it would require that “enforcement measures be complete before any immigrant on probationary status can earn a green card.” It was not immediately clear whether the White House would support such linkage.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: Mr. Obama’s administration has been working on immigration legislation for years.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: But the issue shot to the top of the president’s second-term agenda after his re-election in November, when Hispanic voters backed him in large numbers.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: White House officials are betting that Republicans will be eager to embrace immigration changes as a way of repairing their image with an important voting bloc.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: But getting legislation passed remains tricky, especially in the Republican-controlled House, and Mr. Obama has made it clear he will take a back seat to lawmakers if it will help.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: Negotiations are taking place among a bipartisan group of senators, a separate group in the House, and labor leaders and the U.S. Chamber of Commerce.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: Representative Paul D. Ryan, Republican of Wisconsin, praised Mr. Obama’s tone on the issue last week, saying the president “actually doesn’t want to politicize this, which is conducive to getting something done.” On Wednesday, the White House said Mr. Obama met with Democratic senators at the White House to get a status report on the pace of progress on the legislation.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: In a statement after the meeting, White House officials said the president reiterated his pledge to become more involved if necessary.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: The statement said Mr. Obama told them “he expects the process to continue to move forward and stands ready to introduce his own legislation if Congress fails to act.” It remains unclear how long the president is willing to wait.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: In interviews with Spanish-language television stations after his speech last month, Mr. Obama suggested that he wanted to see real progress by March, when lawmakers had said they hoped to have reached an agreement.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: “If they can get a piece of legislation debated on the floor by March I think that’s a good timeline.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: And I think that can be accomplished,” he said on Univision last month.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: “I’m not going to lay down a particular date because I want to give them a little bit of room to debate.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: If it slips a week, that’s one thing.

column3: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
column4: If it starts slipping three months, that’s a problem.”

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: “Fierce as a dog with tongue lapping for action, cunning as a savage pitted against the wilderness…” \-- Carl Sandburg’s poem “Chicago.” How tough are Chicago’s gun laws?

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: A 55-year-old woman who works as a researcher at the University of Illinois at Chicago was jailed this week for bringing a pistol -- licensed, unloaded and in a case – to her office.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: The woman, who also holds an “Illinois firearm owners registration card,” told Chicago police that she had brought the handgun, recently purchased for home defense, to her workplace because she did not want to leave it at her residence while a work crew was there doing a renovation project.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: But Chicago has perhaps the toughest gun laws in the nation and carrying the weapon, even without ammunition, is a serious offense.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: A co-worker spotted the pistol case and called police who came and snatched up the information specialist from her workplace.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: The Chicago Tribune reports that the woman was held on $25,000 bond pending trial and placed on leave by the university.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: Not too far away on the city’s West Side, Chicago Police were having less luck in dealing with another crime that day than they did with the case of the pistol packing information specialist.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: An unidentified male was found stabbed to death in an alleyway, marking the 50th murder in the city so far this year.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: The victim was later identified as a 22-year-old from across town in Calumet City, but given the low rate at which the city’s 535 murders last year were solved, it looks unlikely that police will soon be identifying the one who did the stabbing.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: President Obama is back in his hometown today to make another pitch for his “cradle to career” educational initiatives.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: But while he’s in town, the president will surely have to address the murder epidemic that has gripped the city.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: It’s not that Chicago rivals murder wastelands like New Orleans or Detroit, but what’s happening is very alarming for locals.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: While murder rates in the nation continue to decline, Chicago has seen sharp increases.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: While murder rates in New York dropped to an all time low last year, Chicago was approaching numbers not seen since the crack wars of the early 1990s.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: So why is Chicago unraveling while New York is stabilizing?

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: It’s hard to say exactly, but the city’s mayor, a former congressman, a former chief of staff to Obama and a potential future presidential contender, believes he knows.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: Rahm Emanuel has gone to war on guns.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: Emanuel is doing everything he can to get the guns out of his city, taking up the cause with new vigor following the mass shooting in Connecticut last year.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: [pullquote] But as the jailed University of Illinois at Chicago researcher can attest, the gun laws are already pretty darn stiff.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: Remember, it’s not as if the police discovered the mix up and told her to take her gun home, they took her to jail for having a licensed, registered weapon that without ammunition was only about as deadly as a desktop stapler.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: And one could hardly blame her for her recent purchase of the weapon given the deteriorating security situation in her neighborhood and the city at large.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: It’s not just murders.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: Shootings, robberies and other crimes are all up in the city, with shopkeepers and homeowners demanding protection.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: As for her ignorance of the city’s gun laws, well, one supposes she understands now.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: Emanuel urgently needs to stem the crime wave in his city.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: His political future and the city’s economic fate depend on erasing the growing perception of Chicago returning to its most lawless days, the era of Cabrini-Green and the crack wars.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: And at the very least he needs to demonstrate that it is gun makers who are more to blame than he, whose mayoralty has coincided with the crime wave.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: The question for the president is whether he can make the case that a national gun ban would be effective in reducing murder rates given the results in Chicago.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: And Now, A Word From Charles “This isn't just any new entitlement.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: It's an entitlement that we know the $7 billion a year that we spend on Head Start doesn't make any difference after the third grade.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: There is a study that HHS has done that shows that.

column3: ChicagoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Murder Epidemic Complicates Obama Gun Ban Pitch
column4: It's a failure, and yet he wants to double down to make it universal.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: CHICAGO — For four years, President Barack Obama avoided talking about guns.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Then the Newtown shooting forced gun control legislation to the top of his agenda — but he still avoided talking about gun violence that has racked his hometown of Chicago.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Story Continued Below But the killing of Hadiya Pendleton drew him back here in a way he could no longer avoid.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Friday afternoon, Obama will return to the area he used to represent in the state Senate, and the neighborhood where the 15-year-old was gunned down by gun violence just a week after performing at his Inauguration.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Even though his speech will focus on some of the policies aimed at helping the middle class and poor that he laid out in his State of the Union address Tuesday, according to a White House official said, he’ll use the chance to acknowledge violence here and across the country.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Complicating things further as he approaches the topic: The explosion of gun violence has come under the mayoralty of Rahm Emanuel, Obama’s former chief of staff.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: And that’s despite tough gun laws in the city — a contrast that’s fed arguments from gun control opponents that none of the laws the president’s pushing on a national level would do much to solve the problem.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Gun violence is a familiar topic to Obama — he launched his career as a community organizer and spent seven years as a local elected official representing some of the toughest neighborhoods of Chicago.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: And though he hasn’t spent much time back here since moving to the White House, the city is still home for the president.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: But conscious of upsetting pro-gun groups and of appearing to undermine Emanuel, he’s made only a few passing mentions over the past year about Chicago street violence — which included 506 murders last year.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Unlike former presidents, Obama can’t deny that he has a deep understanding of the cycle of poverty, drugs and guns that plagues neighborhoods of cities like Chicago, said the Rev.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Jesse Jackson, who had been calling for Obama to return home since soon after Pendleton was killed on Jan. 29.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: “He knows the problems; he’s seen them; and this perfect storm of events means he’s coming home to talk about them,” Jackson said.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: “Because he knows, he can help illuminate the urban crisis and call out for real action.” Emanuel discussed the visit in similar terms earlier in the week.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: “Given that the lion’s share of both the perpetrators and the victims are young African-American men,” Emanuel asked, “who better to have that discussion than the president of the United States, who has repeatedly talked about fathering and the role of fathering?” Obama’s most forceful moment of his State of the Union address Tuesday was when he implored Congress to vote on gun legislation.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: The victims “deserve a vote,” he said in a refrain that drew a standing ovation as he mentioned Pendleton, former Rep. Gabrielle Giffords (D-Ariz.) and other victims of gun violence.

column3: Obama addresses gun control legislation in Chicago
column4: Pendleton’s parents joined first lady Michelle Obama in the chamber for the speech a few days after she had traveled to Chicago with Education Secretary Arne Duncan and senior adviser Valerie Jarrett for the 15-year-old’s memorial service.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: WASHINGTON -- Senate Republicans successfully foiled attempts to confirm Chuck Hagel for the post of defense secretary on Thursday, by denying him the 60 votes needed for the nomination to proceed.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Democrats ultimately came up short of the 60 votes needed to invoke cloture and end the Republicans' filibuster, with a final vote count of 58 to 40.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Republican Sens.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Mike Johanns (Neb.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: ), Susan Collins (Maine), Thad Cochran (Miss.)

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: and Lisa Murkowski (Alaska) voted with Democrats in their failed effort to end debate.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Sen. Orrin Hatch (R-Utah) voted present.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: The nomination is hardly dead.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: In fact, it looks increasingly likely that Democrats will be able to muster the needed votes to confirm Hagel's nomination after a 10-day recess.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: But the failure to end the GOP filibuster is still is a setback for the administration, which wanted a fast confirmation process, and Senate Democratic leadership, whose decision to punt on filibuster reform at the beginning of this congressional session was met with criticism.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Earlier in the day, Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid (D-Nev.) said it was "tragic" that Senate Republicans decided to filibuster a "qualified nominee."

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "It's really unfortunate," Reid said on the Senate floor.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Leaving the Senate floor after the vote, Murkowski explained her decision to break with her party.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "I said I was not going to support a filibuster and I stuck by my word," she said.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Thursday's vote marked the latest chapter in the controversy over Hagel, named as nominee for defense secretary by President Barack Obama just over one month ago.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Republicans, and some Democrats, immediately expressed their reservations over Obama's pick, mostly due to comments Hagel made criticizing the U.S. mission in Iraq and the influence of the Israel lobby in Washington, as well as his public support for a diplomatic resolution to confronting Iran's nuclear program.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: A White House administration official expressed confidence that Hagel's nomination would be confirmed shortly.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "Senator Hagel is going to be confirmed, if not tomorrow then when the Senate returns from recess," the official told The Huffington Post.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: A growing number of Republicans had said shortly before that they would vote to end debate after recess -- but Reid proceeded with the vote before the break anyway, arguing against the precedent it would set to honor a hold on a cabinet nominee.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Reid himself had to change his original vote and ultimately vote against the cloture that would end the filibuster, because doing so allows him to bring the nomination up for another vote at any time.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Republicans insisted they were waiting on requests for more answers on Hagel's finances, as well as specific intelligence on the attacks in Benghazi, Libya.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: The White House said it sent a letter that answered all of their questions, but GOP senators maintained they needed more time and would be ready to proceed with an up-or-down vote when the Senate reconvenes after recess.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "We haven't had much of a debate -- people outside the committee," Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) told reporters.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "So we feel like when we come back next week after the break, unless there's some bombshell, I'd be ready to move on to vote."

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Sen. John Barrasso (R-Wyo.)

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: noted that Democrats themselves weren't entirely comfortable with Hagel's hearing and that they had privately shared their concerns with him.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Some Republicans said they didn't have outstanding questions of their own, but were voting in support of their colleagues who felt differently.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "I actually have [no questions] of my own," said Sen. Bob Corker (R-Tenn.).

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "I'm not on the committee.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: But again … this is not the normal situation.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Cloture is about ending the debate, and all Republicans are saying is we're not ready to vote yet.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: It's all about just people wanting the time for the information to come back."

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: But Sen. Carl Levin (D-Mich.) wasn't buying the Republicans' rationale.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "The floor has been available for people to speak yesterday and today.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: I've heard no speeches," he said.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "Everything they've asked for they got."

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "At some point you just sort of say well, there's something else going on as opposed to just wanting information," he added.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Reid decried the outcome immediately after the vote Thursday evening, emphasizing the need to relieve outgoing Defense Secretary Leon Panetta of his obligations and confirm Hagel at a time when the country continues to face military challenges.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "There is nothing going to change in the next 10 days about the qualifications of Chuck Hagel," Reid said.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "I'm going to go call Chuck Hagel when I finish here and say, I'm sorry -- sorry this has happened.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: I'm sorry for the president, I'm sorry for the country, and I'm sorry for you, but we're not going to give up on you," he added.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Reid said he will bring up another vote to invoke cloture on Tuesday, Feb. 26, when the Senate returns from recess.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Senate Minority Whip John Cornyn (R-Texas) responded by saying that Reid knew exactly why Republicans were unwilling to end the debate over Hagel's nomination.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "The majority leader knows full well that the reason why cloture was denied or the debate -- closing off debate was denied is because there are reasonable requests being made on this side for additional information," Cornyn said, adding that the Republicans' resistance was not an attempt to kill the nomination or even to filibuster.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Sen. Dick Durbin (D-Ill.) called it a filibuster "by every definition."

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: The Senate majority whip said it was "peculiar" that Hagel continues to face such strong opposition from his own GOP colleagues, even though he made an effort to sit down with many of them privately to address their concerns.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: Said Durbin, "This is not a name that just was dropped out of the blue."

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: The White House condemned the actions of Senate Republicans in a statement after the vote Thursday evening.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "Today, Senate Republicans put political posturing ahead of our nation’s security.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: For the first time in American history, Senate Republicans filibustered a nominee for Secretary of Defense -- a member of their own party, a decorated combat veteran, and the right leader for our troops," the statement reads.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "This waste of time is not without consequence.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: We have 66,000 men and women deployed in Afghanistan, and we need our new Secretary of Defense to be a part of significant decisions about how we bring that war to a responsible end.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "For the sake of national security, it’s time to stop playing politics with our Department of Defense, and to move beyond the distractions and delay," the statement concludes.

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: "Allow this war hero an up or down vote, and let our troops have the Secretary of Defense they deserve."

column3: Chuck Hagel Confirmation: Senate Vote Fails To End Filibuster On Obama Pick
column4: This is a developing story and has been updated.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Senate Republicans have at least temporarily blocked the confirmation of former Sen. Chuck Hagel as the next Secretary of Defense.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Democrats' cloture motion to proceed to an up-or-down vote failed 58-40, with one Senator voting "present."

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Achieving cloture requires 60 votes.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Let's be candid: Hagel (a Republican) is unqualified for this job, which is arguably the most important position in a presidential cabinet.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: He all but admitted as much during his disastrous Senate hearings last month: During prickly exchanges with his former Senate colleagues, Hagel downplayed and "clarified" previous denunciations of the, er, "Jewish lobby," which he once accused of regularly "intimidating" members of Congress.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: He also butchered the administration's position on a nuclear Iran, twice getting his facts wrong.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Eventually a sympathetic Democrat was forced to step in and rescue the floundering witness: Matters didn't improve when Mr. Hagel announced, regarding Iran's nuclear capacity, that he supported the president's strong position on "containment."

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: But the administration's policy is not, as Mr. Hagel apparently had yet to learn, containment—it is to prevent Iran's development of nuclear arms.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Nudged by a note handed him by an aide, the nominee corrected himself and declared that in fact the U.S. doesn't have a policy on containment.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: This was one misstatement too many for Carl Levin—the committee chairman, a Democrat and supporter of Mr. Hagel's nomination—who ended the discussion with his own terse correction: "We do have a position on containment, and that is we do not favor containment."

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Even many Democrats and media commentators didn't bother sugarcoating Hagel's dreadful performance.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Republicans have continued to hammer away at Hagel for his record on Israel, Iran, and terrorism -- including votes against tougher sanctions on the Iranian regime and a refusal to classify Iran's revolutionary guard as a terrorist organization.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Hagel was also the only US Senator who declined to sign a statement decrying anti-Semitism in Russia, though he says his refusal to sign had nothing to do with the content of the letter.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Just today, another blast from Hagel's rhetorical past came to light: Fox News Channel on Tuesday reported that secretary of defense nominee Chuck Hagel failed to disclose to the United States Senate speeches delivered to controversial groups such as the American-Arab Anti-Discrimination Committee as well as James Zogby’s Arab American Institute.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Meanwhile, a 2007 speech then-Sen. Hagel delivered at Rutgers University in New Jersey as he tested the waters for a presidential run is drawing fresh scrutiny.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Hagel said the U.S. Department of State was an adjunct of the Israeli foreign minister’s office, according to a contemporaneous report of the event.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: President Obama's nominee for Secretary of Defense is testy about the influence of the "Jewish lobby" and basically said that the State Department is run by Israel.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: The government of Iran has effectively endorsed his nomination.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Opponents of the nomination are demanding more financial disclosures from Hagel, particularly regarding foreign income; the White House is fighting these calls for increased transparency, as are many Congressional Democrats who once demanded similar information from Bush appointees.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: In short, Hagel is an incompetent who was utterly unprepared for his confirmation hearings, has demonstrated an enduring hostility towards Israel and possibly Jews generally, and has a voting record that's worrisomely soft on outlaw regimes that threaten our security.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: And yet he enjoys universal support among Senate Democrats, whose only apparent standard for a evaluating a nominee for a critical position is whether or not the man who picked him is named 'Barack Obama.'

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: It's widely believed, incidentally, that the president is high on Hagel because he'll provide some helpful bipartisan gloss when Obama makes deep military cuts.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Which brings us to another disquieting moment of candor:  Unless Republicans can unearth additional damaging oppo research on Hagel, he will be confirmed sooner or later.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Parting thought, via Allahpundit: Serious question: If Hagel doesn’t deserve to be blocked, who does?

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: His opponents have seized on his anti-Israel rhetoric, more of which emerges every week, but as contemptible as it is, I don’t think that’s reason to filibuster.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Democrats are right when they say that the president deserves wide latitude in choosing his cabinet; if The One wants to bear the political consequences of appointing a guy known for babbling about the “Jewish lobby,” that’s on him.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: The reason to block Hagel is that he’s manifestly unprepared for the job and isn’t all that shy about admitting it.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: When concerns about a nominee shift from political disagreement to questions about his basic competence then the “advise and consent” role should require stopping the nomination even with a filibuster.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: At that point it’s no longer a dispute over foreign policy, it’s about protecting the military from mismanagement.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Typically you don’t worry about a president putting the Senate in a position like that but Obama wants his Republican rubber-stamp nominee so he’s willing to skimp on qualifications.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: He deserves to have a pick this cynical blocked.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: UPDATE \- Harry Reid reacted to the cloture failure by grumpily carrying on about how Republicans' obstructionism has caused a crisis by leaving the nation with no acting Secretary of Defense.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Unsurprisingly, this is a lie.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Reid voted 'no' with Republicans, a procedural manuever that allows him to call a follow-up vote in the coming days.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: UPDATE II \- Some Republican Senators are now pledging to allow a vote on Hagel next week.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Meanwhile, Jennifer Rubin has video of Hagel giving a speech to the American-Arab Anti-Discrimination League in which he complains about the United States trying to "dictate" to Iran over its illegal nuclear program.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Rubin replies:  "We can’t 'dictate' to Iran?

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: We are of course attempting to enforce multiple United Nations sanctions and resolutions of which Iran is in violation.

column3: Senate Republicans Block Hagel Confirmation....For Now
column4: Does he take the side of Iran, that it has a 'right' to pursue its nuclear weapons program?"

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: President Obama's approach to so-called "climate change" appears to include recycling old ideas.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: In his State of the Union address, the president recycled the idea of spending more on education, though we are still getting unsatisfactory results.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: A fact he inadvertently acknowledged by saying we're not keeping up with other countries in science and math.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: He maintained there are tens of thousands of jobs available but companies can't fill them because public schools aren't teaching students what they need to know.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: We spend huge sums on education already, so money and achievement must not be related.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Infrastructure?

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: We've heard that before, too.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Why is nothing ever fixed with all the money that's been spent the last four years?

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Because it's about maintaining union jobs, not creating new jobs that produce products and services and grow small businesses.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: [pullquote] The president mentioned the coming sequester, but Douglas Elmendorf, the director of the Congressional Budget Office, told the Senate's Committee on the Budget, that he can't score the proposal to replace the sequester because he hasn't yet seen "a specific proposal."

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The sequester was the president's idea, though he now suggests it came from Congress.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The House has proposed targeted spending cuts that protect defense.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Those proposals have gone nowhere in the Senate.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The president spoke of "...the basic bargain that built this country -- the idea that if you work hard and meet your responsibilities, you can get ahead."

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Yes, and if you do you will be taxed at ever increasing rates, labeled rich and powerful and accused of not doing your fair share.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: What would be fair is for government to stop spending more than it takes in.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The president claimed his national health insurance is driving down medical costs.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: It's actually the reverse.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: ABC News reported on the conclusion of the nonpartisan Health Care Institute: "Spending on health care rose 4.6 percent in 2011 -- up $4,500 per person, on average."

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The network also noted a Kaiser Family Foundation report that said, "Health insurance premiums for individuals and families also climbed year-over-year, up 3 percent ($186) on average for an individual and 4 percent ($672) on average for a family."

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The Washington Times reported, "President Obama's health care law will push 7 million people out of their job-based insurance coverage -- nearly twice the previous estimate, according to the latest estimates from the Congressional Budget Office..." The president spoke of reducing America's nuclear arsenal at a time when Iran and North Korea are building theirs and threatening nuclear attack.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: This is part of the failed ideology he has applied to the Middle East, which says that if we will just be nice to our enemies, they will be nice to us.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The president promised to cut the deficit in half by the end of his first term.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Instead, he has deepened our deficit and national debt.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Jobs?

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, since Barack Obama took office in 2009, 8.5 million Americans have given up looking for work.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Those lucky enough to find work, often receive very low pay.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The president's proposed increase in the minimum wage won't help create new jobs.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: If it passes, which it won't in the House, it will more than likely eliminate new hires.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: There are so many more recycled ideas, but not enough space here to list them all.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Sen. Marco Rubio (R-Fla.) gave one of the better and more substantive responses to a State of the Union address.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Rubio sought to identify with the common man, noting his Florida home is among middle-class people.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: He retold his story as the son of immigrant parents and made the case for smaller government, rewarding initiative entrepreneurship and improving education through school choice.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The state of the union would be much better if government were smaller and if people were allowed to keep and spend more of their hard-earned money.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: President Obama takes the liberal view; Marco Rubio the conservative view.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: The debate in the next two elections will be between the party that wants to empower government and the party of individual empowerment; between recycling old and failed ideas and trying new ones.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: Cal Thomas is America's most widely syndicated op-ed columnist.

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
column4: His latest book is "What Works: Common Sense Solutions for a Stronger America".

column3: Sigh, President Obama is simply our recycler-in-chief
