column4: But how does Obama himself factor in to all this?

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: The president says that Republicans are punished for being too chummy with him, but what about when goes out and attacks Republicans?

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: What about when he made a fiscal cliff deal all but impossible by hectoring and goading conservatives into opposition.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: In his own unified theory of media destruction, wouldn’t the president acknowledge that his own attacks, including the accusation that Republicans are working against what they know to be the best interests of the nation, would have some effect?

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: Wouldn’t Obama have done better to reach a deal on taxes and spending if he had given John Boehner some cover rather than hitting the campaign trail?

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: If Obama stands silent on the immigration deal or even complains that he will have to sign it even though it represents a painful sacrifice, then we will know he actually believes his own spin on the double bias of media.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: If Obama presses for more or revels in victory, he would be blowing up the deal under his own stated view of how the right operates.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: If the political world is constituted as he claims it is, wouldn’t the patriotic thing for Obama to do be staying out of it except to briefly wince at the concessions he is making before signing a law?

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: We’ll soon find out whether the president is on the level.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: Chris Stirewalt is digital politics editor for Fox News, and his POWER PLAY column appears Monday-Friday on FoxNews.com.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: Catch Chris Live online daily at 11:30amET  at  http:live.foxnews.com.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: Chris Stirewalt joined Fox News Channel (FNC) in July of 2010 and serves as politics editor based in Washington, D.C. Additionally, he authors the daily Fox News Halftime Report political news note and co-hosts the hit podcast, Perino & Stirewalt: I'll Tell You What.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: He also is the host of Power Play, a feature video series on FoxNews.com.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: Stirewalt makes frequent appearances on network programs, including America’s Newsroom, Special Report with Bret Baier and Fox News Sunday with Chris Wallace.

column3: Will Obama Blow Up Immigration Deal?
column4: He also provides expert political analysis for FNC’s coverage of state, congressional and presidential elections.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: WASHINGTON -- President Barack Obama said on Wednesday that he hopes immigration reform can be passed into law by June, but in the meantime he has no plans to halt or slow deportations, despite pleas from advocates.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Obama gave interviews to two Spanish-language outlets, Univision and Telemundo, on Wednesday, the day after he delivered a major speech on immigration reform.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: He argued that much of the legislative work on the issue is already done, given years of work by a number of members of Congress and his own administration.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Now, the struggle is about convincing lawmakers to sign on, he told Telemundo's José Díaz-Balart.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "Really the issue here is not so much technical as it is political," Obama said on Telemundo.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "It's a matter of Republicans and Democrats coming together and finding a meeting of the minds and then making the case.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: And, you know, I'm hopeful that this can get done and I don't think that it should take many, many months."

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: He predicted to both outlets that reform would happen, but sounded a note of caution.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "The one thing I can guarantee is my effort," Obama told Telemundo.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "I can guarantee that I will put everything I've got behind it.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: We're putting our shoulder to the wheel."

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Until then, Obama said his administration will continue its current policies on deportation.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: The percentage of criminals deported on his watch has increased -- though "criminal" is broadly defined -- and removals have hit record numbers.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Obama told Díaz-Balart that he has to enforce the current law.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "I make no apologies for us enforcing the law as well as the work that we've done to strengthen border security," he said.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Asked whether deportations would keep coming, Obama said, "That may be a moot question, because I anticipate us being able to get comprehensive immigration reform done," adding that he would change the law unilaterally if he could.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Speaking to Univision in a separate interview, Obama said he cannot stop deportations.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "I'm not a king," he told anchor Maria Elena Salinas.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "There are still going to be stories that are heartbreaking with respect to deportations until we get comprehensive immigration reform," he said.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "That's one of the reasons I think it's so important for us to go ahead and get this action done."

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: The issue of enforcement is a major one as the immigration debate moves forward.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Many Republicans charge the president has refused to police the border and enforce current law, and therefore can't be trusted to prevent more unauthorized immigration in the future.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: A framework offered this week by the Senate "gang of eight" -- four Republicans and four Democrats -- would tie green cards to border security, while still allowing undocumented immigrants already in the country to gain immediate provisional status.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Obama's plan includes a pathway to citizenship without a border security trigger, but also calls for more enforcement.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: The White House has not said whether he would be open to the idea of green cards connected to border security issues, but he told Univision his priority is a clear pathway to citizenship.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "What we don't want to do is create some kind of vague prospect in the future that somehow comprehensive immigration reform that includes a pathway to citizenship will happen, you know, mañana," he said.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "We want to make sure we are very clear this legislation provides a real pathway."

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: Obama said in his speech Tuesday that he would make Congress vote on his legislation for immigration reform if members are not able to come up with their own bill.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: But he told Univision he is willing to be somewhat flexible on the timeline.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "If they are on a path, as they have already said, where they want to get a bill done by March, then I think that's a reasonable timeline and I think we can get that done," he said.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: "I'm not going to lay down a particular date because I want to give them a little room to debate.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: If it slips a week, that's one thing.

column3: Obama On Immigration: 'We're Putting Our Shoulder To The Wheel'
column4: If it starts slipping three months, that's a problem."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: WASHINGTON –  Defense secretary nominee Chuck Hagel endured a barrage of criticism Thursday during his all-day confirmation hearing on Capitol Hill, challenged repeatedly by Republican lawmakers about his past positions on Israel, Iran, Iraq and other issues he'd be sure to confront at the helm of the Pentagon.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: The former Nebraska Republican senator was compelled under questioning to walk back a series of past statements, including one in which he complained about the "Jewish lobby."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: He had several sparring partners throughout the day, but was questioned perhaps most aggressively by fellow Vietnam War veteran Sen. John McCain and freshman Texas Sen. Ted Cruz, both Republicans.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel was caught by surprise when Cruz played two tapes from appearances on Al Jazeera -- one of which showed him not challenging a caller who accused Israel of war crimes, another in which he appeared to agree with the assertion that America is "the world's bully."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Of the Israel interview, Cruz said: "The caller suggests that the nation of Israel has committed war crimes, and your response to that was not to dispute that characterization."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: He then asked Hagel directly whether he thinks Israel has committed war crimes.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: "No, I do not," Hagel said, while saying he wanted to see the "full context" of the interview.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Cruz called the war-crimes suggestion "particularly offensive given that the Jewish people suffered under the most horrific war crimes in the Holocaust."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: "I would also suggest," he continued, "that for ... a prospective secretary of Defense not to take issue with that claim is highly troubling."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Cruz then played the tape of Hagel being asked about the perception and "reality" that America is the world's bully.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel could be heard calling the point a "good one."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Cruz said the answer is "not the conduct one would expect of a secretary of Defense."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel disagreed with Cruz' characterization of his answers.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Further, Senate Armed Services Committee Chairman Carl Levin said he had told Cruz he would have preferred he use a transcript and not air that interview.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Levin, a Democrat, later said he thought Hagel "really advanced his own cause" at the hearing.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: The incident, though, was one of several confrontations Thursday as the committee considered Hagel's nomination to succeed Leon Panetta at the Pentagon.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel is among the most controversial of President Obama's second-term Cabinet nominees.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: The committee adjourned late Thursday afternoon without voting on the nomination.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Just days earlier, Sen. John Kerry easily won confirmation to be secretary of State.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel, though, did not enjoy such a warm reception.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: It was the troop surge in Iraq that became a flashpoint between McCain and Hagel during Thursday's hearing.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: McCain repeatedly tried to get Hagel to answer whether he was "right or wrong" when he once called the troop surge a "dangerous foreign policy blunder."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: "I'm not going to give you a yes or no -- I think it's far more complicated than that.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: I'll defer that judgment to history," Hagel said, adding that he was referring to both the overall Iraq war, as well as the surge, in that comment McCain fired back: "I think history has already made a judgment about the surge, sir, and you're on the wrong side of it."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: The senator added that Hagel's "refusal" to answer the question "will have an impact" on whether he votes for his nomination.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: McCain's position on Hagel could be a significant bellwether for his nomination.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: The two veterans once had a close relationship during their years in the Senate, but politics and Hagel's opposition to increased troop numbers in Iraq divided the two men.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: In order to have a lock on the nomination, Hagel would need the support of all Senate Democrats and at least five Republicans -- just in case Republicans call for a 60-vote threshold to proceed to the confirmation vote.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: It's possible Hagel would not need that many, though.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel, during the hearing, urged lawmakers not to write him off based on a string of controversial votes and quotes from his career in the Senate.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: "Like each of you, I have a record," Hagel said Thursday.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: "A record that I'm proud of.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: I'm proud of my record not because of any accomplishments I may have achieved, or certainly because of an absence of mistakes, but rather because I've tried to build that record based on living my life and fulfilling my responsibilities as honestly as I knew how and with hard work."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: He continued: "But no one individual vote, no one individual quote, no one individual statement defines me, my beliefs, or my record.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: My overall worldview has never changed: that America has and must maintain the strongest military in the world; that we must lead in the international community to confront threats and challenges together ... that we must use all our tools of American power to protect our citizens and our interests."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: He noted he's cast "over 3,000 votes" during his time in the Senate and given "hundreds of interviews and speeches."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: But the top Republican on the Armed Services Committee, Sen. Jim Inhofe of Oklahoma, announced at the start of the hearing that he would be opposing Hagel.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: "On many of the security challenges facing U.S. interests around the world, Senator Hagel's record is deeply troubling, and out of the mainstream.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Too often it seems he's willing to subscribe to a worldwide view that is predicated on appeasing our adversaries while shunning our friends," he said.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Further, he accused Hagel of recent "reversals" in his opinions "that seem based on political expediency rather than on core beliefs."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Levin, D-Mich., also said Hagel's positions -- including opposition to unilateral sanctions on Iran and criticism of efforts to isolate both Syria and Hamas -- must be "explored at this hearing."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Still, he said Hagel -- as a veteran -- has "critically important qualifications" of understanding the consequences of using military force.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel later defended his opposition to unilateral sanctions on Iran, saying he took that position a decade ago, which he described as a "different time."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: He did at one point describe the Iran government as "legitimate."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: As for claims that he's got a shaky position toward Israel, he said "I've never voted against Israel ever in the 12 years I was in the Senate."

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Two former committee chairmen -- Democrat Sam Nunn and Republican John Warner -- introduced and endorsed the nominee at the top of the hearing.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: If confirmed, Hagel, a decorated Vietnam combat veteran, would be the first enlisted man and first Vietnam veteran to serve as defense secretary.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel has the announced backing of about a dozen Democrats and the tacit support of dozens more who are unlikely to embarrass the president by defeating his Cabinet pick.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: One Republican -- Sen. Thad Cochran of Mississippi -- has said he will vote for his former colleague.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Six Republicans, including four members of the Armed Services panel, have said they will oppose Hagel's nomination.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: A recent Fox News poll showed 34 percent of voters saying they would vote to confirm Hagel, while 25 percent would not.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: The rest had not heard of him.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., earlier this month described Obama's selection as an "in-your-face" pick but was a bit less critical this week.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel testified Thursday that he is committed to Obama's national security agenda.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Addressing concerns about his stance on Iran, he said "all options must be on the table" to prevent Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: He also said it's important that the county "not hesitate to use the full force" of the military in defense of security, "but we must also be smart, and more importantly wise," in how that power is employed.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: The hearing was the first time Hagel publicly addressed the barrage of criticism that he is not sufficiently pro-Israel or tough enough on Iran.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel has also been criticized for his comments about the influence of a "Jewish lobby" and his view of gay rights.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: Hagel apologized for the "Jewish lobby" comment Thursday.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: He addressed several of the issues in a 112-page questionnaire to the committee in which he said his wartime experience would shape his decisions about using military force.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: In his responses, Hagel adopted a hard line on Iran and its possible pursuit of a nuclear weapon.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: He echoed Obama's view that all options are feasible to stop Tehran, praised the rounds of penalties and warned of "severe and growing consequences" if Iran balks at international demands.

column3: Hagel faces GOP grilling at confirmation hearing
column4: The Associated Press contributed to this report.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: > Real gross domestic product -- the output of goods and services produced by labor and property located in the United States -- decreased at an annual rate of 0.1 percent in the fourth quarter of 2012 (that is, from the third quarter to the fourth quarter), according to the "advance" estimate released by the Bureau of Economic Analysis.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: In the third quarter, real GDP increased 3.1 percent.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: > The downturn in real GDP in the fourth quarter primarily reflected downturns in private inventory investment, in federal government spending, in exports, and in state and local government spending that were partly offset by an upturn in nonresidential fixed investment, a larger decrease in imports, and an acceleration in PCE.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: A 22% decline in federal military spending drove the economic contraction.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: Nonmilitary spending by the federal government increased by 6%, but clearly does not offset the decline in military spending cuts.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: One possibility for why defense spending declined so sharply is the looming threat of the budget sequester brought on by 2011's Budget Control Act.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: The Department of Defense has been threatened with fairly steep budget cuts, which they may have attempted to make up for in Q3 2012 before paring back in Q4.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: > That is, the Defense Department was facing the prospect of losing additional money that had already been budgeted over multiple years but hadn’t been spent.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: That led to a big spending spree before the end of the fiscal year, which was followed, inevitably, by a big drop in the October through December.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: The March budget sequester is still scheduled to take place, and the Congressional Budget Office estimates that the defense spending cuts will touch off a 0.4% drop in GDP.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: Members of Congress from both sides of the aisle will have to agree on some sort of package to delay the cuts.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: A potential recession might get them to agree.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: The GDP report wasn't all bad, though.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: As Megan McArdle reports: > The good news, such as it is, is that personal consumption spending and investment were humming along, growing 2.2% and 8.4%, respectively.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: The boost in personal spending was driven mostly by durable goods, which probably means that people are reaching the limits of hoarding--they've pushed the old car along an extra five years, put up with the oven that doesn't always work, and gone without a dishwasher, but they're now having to replace some stuff.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: This could touch off a recovery, though as Megan writes, the lack of consumer confidence could spell trouble as well.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: The BEA places a particular importance on how unsure they are of their estimates, however.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: So this number could still move in either direction.

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: > The Bureau emphasized that the fourth-quarter advance estimate released today is based on source data that are incomplete or subject to further revision by the source agency (see the box on page 4 and the "Comparisons of Revisions to GDP" on page 5).

column3: Economy Shrinks Due to Military Cuts
column4: The "second" estimate for the fourth quarter, based on more complete data, will be released on February 28, 2013.
